title: Phil Jackson (rugby league 1970s)
text:
Philip Jackson (birth unknown) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Playing career.
International honours.
Phil Jackson won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> in 1975 against Wales, and in the <a href="1975%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1975 Rugby League World Cup</a> against France.
Player's No.6 Trophy Final appearances.
Phil Jackson played right-, i.e. number 10, in <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>'s 3-2 victory over <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> in the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">1974–75</a> <a href="League%20Cup%20%28rugby%20league%29">Player's No.6 Trophy</a> Final during the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1974–75 season</a> at <a href="Wilderspool%20Stadium">Wilderspool Stadium</a>, <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a> on Saturday 25 January 1975.
